description.narrative: Accelerator Lab- the beginnings of new approaches to development solutions, embedded within UNDP’s global architecture and country platforms.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level.
1.2 Diversity of different data sources used
1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented
1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP)
2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners
2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite
2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs
3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network.
3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network.
3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

comment.narrative:
Target 1.1 10 new data sources per year
Target 1.2: 9 different type of data sources per year
Target 1.3: 50 new potential solutions per lab per year
Target 1.4: 10 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Target 2.1: At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year.
Target 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart.
Target 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method.
Target 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Target 3.2: 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related.
Target 3.3.1: The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.
Target 3.3.2: The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account.
Target 3.4.1: Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media.
Target: 3.4.2: Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

(RESULTS ACHIEVED AS OF December 2021)
Result 1.1: 7 new data sources used in 2021 (primary, secondary, open data, surveys, mobile data, GIS, narratives)
Result 1.2: 1 Different types of data sources per year (Kobo tool)
Result 1.3: 10+ new potential solutions identified (plastic waste management, urban mobility, COVID relief and/or recovery, green technology etc.)
Result 1.3: At least 3 innovation methods used for each Action Plan.
Result 2.1: A total of 9 blogs published and 2 research reports on plastic waste management and Digital Socio-Economic Assessment.
Result 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have public sector and local governments involved as counterparts.
Result: 2.3: A total of 2 government entities have adopted our methods. 1. Pokhara Metropolitan City Office adopted the innovative methodology of testing plastic bricks; 2. Ministry of Land Management, Cooperatives and Poverty Alleviation approved and initiated the digital marketing platform for farmers cooperative markets.
Result 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects such as the plastic waste management research is supporting the Promoting Green Recovery Project (PGRP) and digital marketing platform is being developed together with Cooperative Market Development Programme (CMDP).
Results 3.2: 20% of information shared across the network is related to methodology/ SDG issues and opportunities such as solid waste management, innovation, digital transformation, decent work and employment etc.
Result 3.3.1: The Acc Lab Networks work is featured at least 2 times per month on CO social media channels etc.
Result 3.3.2: The lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of Acc Lab either from personal or CO account
Target 3.4.1: A total of 2 Accelerator Lab’s publications have been connected to local development ecosystem through social media.
Target: 3.4.2: Engaged with 5 relevant local social media profiles (of UNDP and others) of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Target 1.1 1 new data sources per year
Target 1.2: 2 different type of data sources per year
Target 1.3: 50 new potential solutions per lab per year
Target 1.4: 3 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Target 2.1: At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year.
Target 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart.
Target 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method.
Target 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Target 3.2: 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related.
Target 3.3.1: The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.
Target 3.3.2: The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account.
Target 3.4.1: Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media.
Target: 3.4.2: Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Target 1.1 5 new data sources per year Target 1.2: 6 different type of data sources per year Target 1.3: 35 new potential solutions per lab per year Target 1.4: 5 innovation methods per Action Plan. Target 2.1: At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year. Target 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. Target 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. Target 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. Target 3.2: 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. Target 3.3.1: The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. Target: 3.3.2: The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. Target 3.4.1: Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Target 3.4.2: Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Result 1.1. 1 new data source per year used in 2020 (Qualitative data such as narrative stories and anecdotes). Result 1.2: 2 different types of data sources per year (Geospatial data and Big Data). Result 1.3: 15 new potential solutions per year entered in the solution mapping platform ranging from solutions to tackle solid waste management, creating employment, COVID response and relief etc. Result 1.4: 3 innovation methods per action plan (ranging from pilots, collective intelligence, prototyping, behavioral change communications, surveys, solutions mapping among others). Result 2.1: 10 blogs published per year along with a video on pocket park experiment. Result 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partners as counterparts. Result 2.3: Yes, one. Collective Intelligence used for Kathmandu Business Hub by UNDP along with Local Government. Result 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects related waste management and unemployment. Result 3.2: 50% of the information shared at both global and regional platforms. Acclab Nepal has also collaborated separately with 5 other Labs for experience sharing. Result 3.3.1 : The work of AccLab is featured 4 times a month on an average. Result 3.3.2: The lab team engages at least five times a month on an average. Result 3.4.1: 2 publications of the Accelerator Lab connected to local development ecosystem through social media. Result 3.4.2: Identified and Engaged with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader development ecosystem.

Target 1.1: 2 new sources of data per year
Target 1.3: 20 new potential solutions per lab per year
Target 1.4: 2 innovation methods per Action Plan
Target 2.1: 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year.
Target 2.2: At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart
Target 2.3: At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods.
Target 2.4: At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Target 3.2: 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related.
Target 3.3.1: The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts.
Target 3.3.2: The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account.

Result 1.1: 1 new source of data used in 2019. AccLab Nepal created GIS map on the open spaces.
Result 1.3: 2 new potential solutions identified. This included the concept of K-Hub and pocket park.
Result 1.4: 1 innovation method per Action Plan. We used Collective Intelligence to finalize the plan and concept of pocket park with multi-stakeholders.
Result 2.1: 1 blog published on urbanization.
Result 2.2: 100% of the learning challenges have public sector and other partners as counterparts. We have partnered with Kathmandu Metropolitan City Office to work on the frontier challenge related to unemployment while we have extended partnership with Lalitpur Metropolitan city Office, Vriskhya Foundation and WWF to experiment on pocket park to tackle the challenge related to urbanization.
Result 2.3: Accelerator Lab partnered with Kathmandu Metropolitan City and worked with Lalitpur Metropolitan City to explore and experiment on Kathmandu Business Hub and Pocket Park respectively
Result 2.4: At least 25% of our learning challenge on unemployment and urbanization are providing actional knowledge. AccLab also organized GIS training to CO project staff can capacitate themselves on exploring and mapping challenges, ideas and solution.
Result 3.2: 5% of the information shared across the network both at regional and global level.
Result 3.3.1: The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured at least twice a month in Country Office social media channels.
Result 3.3.2: The lab team engages at least twice a month in average across any social media conversation.
